Article.Abstract: T cell responses to Ags involve recognition of selected peptide epitopes contained within the antigenic protein. In this report, we describe a new approach for direct identification of CD4+ T cell epitopes of complex Ags that uses human class II tetramers to identify reactive cells. With a panel of 60 overlapping peptides covering the entire sequence of the VP16 protein, a major Ag for HSV-2, we generated a panel of class II MHC tetramers loaded with peptide pools that were used to stain peripheral lymphocytes of an HSV-2 infected individual. With this approach, we identified four new DRA1*0101/DRB1*0401- and two DRA1*0101/DRB1*0404-restricted, VP16-specific epitopes. By using tetramers to sort individual cells, we easily obtained a large number of clones specific to these epitopes. Although DRA1*0101/DRB1*0401 and DRA1*0101/DRB1*0404 are structurally very similar, nonoverlapping VP16 epitopes were identified, illustrating high selectivity of individual allele polymorphisms within common MHC variants. This rapid approach to detecting CD4+ T cell epitopes from complex Ags can be applied to any known Ag that gives a T cell response.
Article.ArticleTitle: Tetramer-guided epitope mapping: rapid identification and characterization of immunodominant CD4+ T cell epitopes from complex antigens.
Article.Affiliations: Virginia Mason Research Center, Benaroya Research Institute, Seattle, WA 98101, USA.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Epitope sequence was deduced from overlapping peptides and truncation analysis, and was shown to bind MHC-II DR*0401 allele and be recognized in that context by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2 infected individual. Residue F at position 3 is the proposed first anchor for DR*0401, as determined by peptide truncation. A.k.a. Alpha trans-inducing protein, Vmw65, ICP25, VP16 protein and Alpha-TIF.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A herpesvirus 2 positive donor PBMCs were used in this study. Source protein was added at 2 Î¼g /ml in the presence of IL-2, for 11- or 12-day stimulation prior to MHC-peptide staining.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-MHC II (DRA1-0101/DRB1*0401) binding to CD4+ from a DRB1*0401, herpes virus 2 positive donor was assessed with 20-mer peptides in a tetramer-guided epitope mapping study. Binding could be detected, both with CD4+ cells and clones, for the peptides containing this epitope, which was subsequently refined by peptide truncation analysis.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A herpesvirus 2 positive donor PBMCs were used in this study. Source protein was added at 2 Î¼g /ml in the presence of IL-2, for 11- or 12-day stimulation prior to MHC-peptide staining, used to sort peptide specific cells from where clones were derived.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide specific CD4+ clones were derived from a DRB1*0401, herpes virus 2 positive donor. They are shown to proliferate in the presence of peptide, although the amount of proliferation does not correlate significantly with the amount of staining with peptide-MHC tetramers for each individual clone.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A herpesvirus 2 positive donor PBMCs were used in this study. Source protein was added at 2 Î¼g /ml in the presence of IL-2, for 11- or 12-day stimulation prior to MHC-peptide staining.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-MHC II (DRA1-0101/DRB1*0404) binding to CD4+ from a DRB1*0404, herpes virus 2 positive donor was assessed with the p10 peptide - containing the epitope - in a tetramer-guided epitope mapping study. No binding could be detected for that peptide as a part of a 5-peptide pool.

This epitope had been detected as DRB1*0401 restricted, for recognition by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2, DR0401/DR0404 positive individual. MHC binding shows higher affinity for DR*0401 than for DR*0404, implying that the limited polymorphism between these alleles (aas 86 and 71 in DRB1) may affect the binding pattern.

This epitope had been detected as DRB1*0401 restricted, for recognition by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2, DR0401/DR0404 positive individual. MHC binding shows diminished but considerable affinity also for DR*0404, implying that the limited polymorphism between these alleles (aas 86 and 71 in DRB1) may affect the binding pattern.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Epitope sequence was deduced from truncation analysis of peptide 441-460, and was shown to bind MHC-II DR*0404 allele and be recognized in that context by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2 infected individual. Residue L at position 3 is the proposed first anchor for DR*0404, as determined by peptide truncation. A.k.a. Alpha trans-inducing protein, Vmw65, ICP25, VP16 protein and Alpha-TIF.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A herpesvirus 2 positive donor PBMCs were used in this study. Source protein was added at 2 Î¼g /ml in the presence of IL-2, for 11- or 12-day stimulation prior to MHC-peptide staining.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-MHC II (DRA1-0101/DRB1*0404) binding to CD4+ from a DRB1*0404, herpes virus 2 positive donor was assessed with peptide p58, containing this epitope, in a tetramer-guided epitope mapping study. Binding could be detected for that peptide, and truncation analysis refined its identity as 443-455.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A herpesvirus 2 positive donor PBMCs were used in this study. Source protein was added at 2 Î¼g /ml in the presence of IL-2, for 11- or 12-day stimulation prior to MHC-peptide staining, used to sort peptide specific cells from where clones were derived.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide specific CD4+ clones were derived from a DRB1*0401, herpes virus 2 positive donor. They are shown to proliferate in the presence of peptide, although the amount of proliferation does not correlate significantly with the amount of staining with peptide-MHC tetramers for each individual clone.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A herpesvirus 2 positive donor PBMCs were used in this study. Source protein was added at 2 Î¼g /ml in the presence of IL-2, for 11- or 12-day stimulation prior to MHC-peptide staining.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-MHC II (DRA1-0101/DRB1*0401) binding to CD4+ from a DRB1*0401, herpes virus 2 positive donor was assessed with peptide p58 -containing this epitope - in a tetramer-guided epitope mapping study. No binding could be detected for that peptide.

This epitope had been detected as DRB1*0404 restricted, for recognition by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2, DR0401/DR0404 positive individual. It shows no binding for DR*0401, implying that the limited polymorphism between these alleles (aas 86 and 71 in DRB1) may affect the binding pattern.

This epitope had been detected as DRB1*0404 restricted, for recognition by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2, DR0401/DR0404 positive individual. MHC binding shows considerable affinity for DR*0404 but not binding to DR*0401, implying that the limited polymorphism between these alleles (aas 86 and 71 in DRB1) may affect the binding pattern.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A herpesvirus 2 positive donor PBMCs were used in this study. Source protein was added at 2 Î¼g /ml in the presence of IL-2, for 11- or 12-day stimulation prior to MHC-peptide staining.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-MHC II (DRA1-0101/DRB1*0401) binding to CD4+ from a DRB1*0401, herpes virus 2 positive donor was assessed with 20-mer peptides in a tetramer-guided epitope mapping study. Binding could be detected, both with CD4+ cells and clones, for the peptides containing this epitope, which was subsequently refined by peptide truncation analysis.

This epitope had been detected as DRB1*0401 restricted, for recognition by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2, DR0401/DR0404 positive individual. MHC binding of similar affinity os seen for DR*0401 and 0404, implying that this epitope may bind both of this alleles, which show limited polymorphism (aas 86 and 71 in DRB1), but T cell recognition in that individual was DR0401 restricted. .

This epitope had been detected as DRB1*0401 restricted, for recognition by CD4+ cells from a herpesvirus 2, DR0401/DR0404 positive individual. MHC binding of similar affinity os seen for DR*0401 and 0404, implying that this epitope may bind both of this alleles, which show limited polymorphism (aas 86 and 71 in DRB1), but T cell recognition in that individual was DR0401 restricted. .
